<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: What is the minimum number of base substitutions that must bemade to change thecodonsfrom a)glutamicacid to lysine? b)leucinetoalanine? c)phenylalaninetoglycine? d)tryptophanto serine? e)valinetoglutamicacid?

A. 1 for phenylalanine to glycine, 2 for the rest

B. 2 for glutamic acid to lysine, 3 for leucine to alanine, 1 for phenylalanine to glycine, 1 for tryptophan to serine, 3 for valine to glutamic acid

C. 1 for all amino acid substitutions

D. 1 for leucine to alanine, 2 for glutamic acid to lysine, phenylalanine to glycine, and valine to glutamic acid, 3 for tryptophan to serine

E. 2 for all amino acid substitutions

F. 2 for glutamic acid to lysine, 1 for leucine to alanine, 1 for phenylalanine to glycine, 2 for tryptophan to serine, 2 for valine to glutamic acid

G. 3 for leucine to alanine, 1 for the rest

H. 1 for glutamic acid to lysine and tryptophan to serine, 3 for the rest

I. 1 for glutamic acid to lysine, 2 for leucine to alanine, 2 for phenylalanine to glycine, 1 for tryptophan to serine, 1 for valine to glutamic acid

J. 3 for glutamic acid to lysine, 2 for leucine to alanine, 2 for phenylalanine to glycine, 1 for tryptophan to serine, 1 for valine to glutamic acid

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>
